meanings.definition: To deceive or swindle (someone) in a game of chance.
meanings.sent1: She was buncoing her friends in the card game.
meanings.sent2: He got caught buncoing at the poker table.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox was buncoing the other animals in the dice game.
meanings.sent4: Her smooth talking was like buncoing the audience into believing her magic trick.
meanings.sent5: The con artist's skill at buncoing was unmatched in the town.

meanings.definition: The act of cheating or tricking someone in a game of chance.
meanings.sent1: Buncoing is not tolerated in fair play.
meanings.sent2: The group discovered the buncoing during the card game.
meanings.sent3: The monkey's playful buncoing in the board game made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The magician's performance was a clever buncoing of the audience's expectations.
meanings.sent5: The detective uncovered the buncoing scheme at the casino.
